intro: Chaenorhinum minus f. luxurians, commonly known as the purple-flowered yellow horned-poppy, is a flowering plant characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range from purple to pink. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is native to southern Europe and western Asia. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces capsule fruits containing numerous small, dark seeds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
